document.docAuthor: Gu, Xin-Yao, Jin, Dao-Chao & Guo, Jian-Jun
document.docTitle: Torrenticola wuyiensis Gu & Guo 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species and one new record of Torrenticolidae (Acari, Hydrachnidia) from Wuyishan with an updated key for Chinese fauna

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species and one new record of Torrenticolidae (Acari, Hydrachnidia) from Wuyishan with an updated key for Chinese fauna

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Institute of Entomology, Guizhou University, Guizhou Provincial Key Laboratory for Plant Pest Management of the Mountainous Region, the Scientific Observing and Experimental Station of Crop Pest in Guiyang, Ministry of Agriculture, P. figureCitation.captionText-0: Fig. 9. Torrenticola wuyiensis Gu & Guo sp. nov., ♂, holotype (FJ-TO-20180807). A. Dorsal view. B. Ventral view. C. Palp, lateral view. D. Infracapitulum and chelicera. E. Ejaculatory complex. Scale bars = 100 μm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: Fig. 10. Torrenticola wuyiensis Gu & Guo sp. nov., ♂, holotype (FJ-TO-20180807). A. leg-I-2–6. B. leg-II. C. leg-III. D. leg-IV-1–4. E. leg-IV-5–6. Scale bar = 100 μm.
figureCitation.captionText-2: Fig. 11. Torrenticola wuyiensis Gu & Guo sp. nov., ♀, paratype (FJ-TO-20180812). A. Dorsal view. B. Ventral view. C. Palp, lateral view. D. Infracapitulum and chelicera. Scale bars = 100 μm.
figureCitation.captionText-3: Fig. 12. Torrenticola wuyiensis Gu & Guo sp. nov., ♀, paratype (FJ-TO-20180812). A. leg-I. B. leg-II. C. leg-III. D. leg-IV-1–4. E. leg-IV-5–6. Scale bar = 100 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Idiosoma elliptical; dorsal plate arrangement: 2+2p+1, posterior pair of anterior platelets half fused to dorsal plate; infracapitular bay wide U-shaped; E
4
on same line with 5 th pair of acetabula.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 9.
Torrenticola wuyiensis Gu & Guo
sp. nov. , ♂ , holotype (FJ-TO-20180807). A . Dorsal view. B . Ventral view. C . Palp, lateral view. D . Infracapitulum and chelicera. E . Ejaculatory complex. Scale bars = 100 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph: This new species is named after Wuyishan (Wuyi Mountain), where the new species was collected.

paragraph.materialsCitation: China • 1 ♂ , 4 ♀♀ ; same collection data as for holotype; FJ-TO-20180808 to FJ-TO-20180812 .

subSubSection.paragraph: BODY. Idiosoma elliptical, L/W ratio 1.44 (1.38) ( Fig. 9B ). Dorsal plate arrangement: 2+2p+1 ( Fig. 9A ). Infracapitular bay wide U-shaped, Cx-II–III mL relatively short; E 4 on same line with 5 th pair of acetabula; V 1 anterior to V 2 , V 2 almost at same level of Ap ( Fig. 9B ). Gnathosoma dorsal apodeme short, ventral

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 10.
Torrenticola wuyiensis Gu & Guo
sp. nov. , ♂ , holotype (FJ-TO-20180807). A . leg-I-2–6. B . leg-II. C . leg-III. D . leg-IV-1–4. E . leg-IV-5–6. Scale bar = 100 μm.

Fig. 11.
Torrenticola wuyiensis Gu & Guo
sp. nov. , ♀ , paratype (FJ-TO-20180812). A . Dorsal view. B . Ventral view. C . Palp, lateral view. D . Infracapitulum and chelicera. Scale bars = 100 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph: MEASUREMENTS. Idiosoma L 826 (705–826), W 573 (495–573). Dorsal shield L 691 (585–691), dorsal plate L 652 (551–652), frontal platelets L 146 (131–146). Infracapitular bay depth 176 (136–176); Cx-I

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 12.
Torrenticola wuyiensis Gu & Guo
sp. nov. , ♀ , paratype (FJ-TO-20180812). A . leg-I. B . leg-II. C . leg-III. D . leg-IV-1–4. E . leg-IV-5–6. Scale bar = 100 μm.

Table 1. Differences in diagnostic characters between
Torrenticola wuyiensis
sp. nov. and
Torrenticola ussuriensis (Sokolow, 1940)
.

tr.th: 1 = VE = ventral extensions; 2 = E 4 on the same line with n pair of acetabula; 3 = DE = distal margin.

subSubSection.paragraph:
This new species is similar to
Torrenticola ussuriensis (Sokolow, 1940)
in the shape of the palp and dorsal plates,.
T. ussuriensis
was originally described by Sokolow (1934) from the Primory Territory in the Russian Far East, and later reported from River Inôzava in Japan ( Enami 1940 ), and from Korea (
Pešić et al. 2013
). Differences between
T. wuyiensis
and
T. ussuriensis
are given in Table 1 .
